sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Supreme Court Building Act.

sections.heading: After the completion of the building herein specified, it shall be
sections.text:
devoted to the uses of the Department of Justice of the State of Illinois,
and be occupied by the Supreme Court, the Attorney General, with his
assistants, the State law library, the Appellate Court for the Fourth
Judicial District, and the other branches of the Department of Justice of
the State now existing or which may hereafter be created.

sections.heading: Use, custody, and control of facilities for the Appellate Court
sections.text:
for the Fourth Judicial District.
After renovation of the building located at 201 West Monroe Street,
Springfield, Illinois (commonly known as the Waterways Building) is completed,
it shall be devoted to the uses of the Appellate Court for the Fourth Judicial
District. The care, custody, and control of the building, when the renovation
is completed, shall be vested in the Supreme Court.
